div.p: This case-insensitive code system https://intellisoft-consulting.github.io/igs/ChanjoKe-FHIR-IG/CodeSystem/IMMZ.EExample defines the following codes:

tr.td: A unique identifier for the instance of the report that has been generated
The status of the report (for example, initial, complete, etc.)
The report is complete and ready to use
The report is currently being generated
An error occurred while generating the report
The type of report which has been generated (i.e. is the report a list of individuals, a summary, etc.)
An individual report which provides information on the performance for a given measure with respect to a single subject
A subject list report that provides a listing of subjects who satisfied a specific population criteria in the measure
A summary report that returns the number of members in each population criteria for the measure
A data exchange report that contains data of interest for the measure (i.e. data needed to calculate the measure)
The indicator or measure definition which is being reported on (for example: Dropout rate, defaulters, etc.)
An indicator for the assessment of a particular vaccine's dropout rate (i.e. comparing the number of clients who start a specific immunization schedule with the number of clients who complete it)
An indicator for the assessment of a particular vaccine's defaulters. Defaulters are clients who miss scheduled vaccination doses for any reason
An indicator for the assessment of a particular vaccine's coverage (i.e. the estimated percentage of clients who have received specific doses of a vaccine)

An indicator for the assessment of a particular vaccine's Adverse Event Following Immunization (AEFI) case rate. This report is tracked as an aggregate tally of number of clients who received a vaccine dose and have reported an adverse event compared with the total number of doses administered of the vaccine product
An indicator for the assessment of a particular vaccine's open vial wastage, which is a measure of the percentage of doses of a vaccine that were opened but discarded due to under-utilization

An indicator for the assessment of a particular vaccine's open vial wastage, which is a measure of the percentage of doses of a vaccine that were spoiled due to reasons such as expiry, freezing, breakage, etc.
Location (facility or place) for which the data in the report is being represented.
The date and time on which the report was generated.
The start date of the reporting period for which data in the report has been included.
The end date of the reporting period for which data in the report has been included.
Indicates to the receiver how to interpret the data (i.e. what constitutes an improvement or deterioration)
Indicates that when the measure scores increase, the data can be interpreted as an improvement (used for Coverage indicator)
Indicates that when measure scores decrease, the data can be interpreted as an improvement (used for dropout, wastage, AEFI indicators)
Indicates the organization, or location which is generating or producing the report

Represents the name of the report/indicator. It codifies the meaning of the group / measure. For example, if the report indicator is Coverage each antigen / vaccine would have a measure (i.e. BCG Coverage or BCG Target)
The calculated score of the measure / indicator which is being reported on.
The count of individual objects (persons, doses, etc.) which was used as the numerator to calculate the measure score.
The count of individual objects (persons, doses, etc.) which was used as the denominator to calculate the measure score.
Indicates the overall strata or disaggregation which is being represented in the report (for example: by gender, by region, by age group, etc.)
Represents a disaggregation grouped by the indicator population's sex values
Represents a disaggregation grouped by the indicator population's administrative regions
Represents a disaggregation grouped by the indicator population's age groups
Represents a disaggregation grouped by the indicator population's dose numbers for a specific vaccine
Represents a disaggregation grouped by the indicator population's vaccine types
Represents a disaggregation grouped by the indicator population's vaccine manufacturers for a specific vaccine
Represents a disaggregation grouped by the indicator population's reaction manifestations for a specific vaccine
Represents a disaggregation grouped by the indicator population's occupations
The type or value of this stratum
The count of individual objects (persons, doses, etc.) which were used as the numerator for the disaggregation score.
The count of individual objects (persons, doses, etc.) which were used as the denominator for disaggregation score
The computed score for this disaggregation, which is the numerator divided by the denominator for this collection (i.e. population) of records.

The status of the report (for example, initial, complete, etc.)
The report is complete and ready to use
The report is currently being generated
An error occurred while generating the report

Indicates that when measure scores decrease, the data can be interpreted as an improvement (used for dropout, wastage, AEFI indicators)

Represents the name of the report/indicator. It codifies the meaning of the group / measure. For example, if the report indicator is Coverage each antigen / vaccine would have a measure (i.e. BCG Coverage or BCG Target)
The calculated score of the measure / indicator which is being reported on.
The count of individual objects (persons, doses, etc.) which was used as the numerator to calculate the measure score.
The count of individual objects (persons, doses, etc.) which was used as the denominator to calculate the measure score.

Represents a disaggregation grouped by the indicator population's sex values

Represents a disaggregation grouped by the indicator population's age groups
Represents a disaggregation grouped by the indicator population's dose numbers for a specific vaccine
Represents a disaggregation grouped by the indicator population's vaccine types
Represents a disaggregation grouped by the indicator population's vaccine manufacturers for a specific vaccine
Represents a disaggregation grouped by the indicator population's reaction manifestations for a specific vaccine
Represents a disaggregation grouped by the indicator population's occupations
The type or value of this stratum
The count of individual objects (persons, doses, etc.) which were used as the numerator for the disaggregation score.
The count of individual objects (persons, doses, etc.) which were used as the denominator for disaggregation score
The computed score for this disaggregation, which is the numerator divided by the denominator for this collection (i.e. population) of records.
